It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks, often in areas with rich, organic soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern in some regions.
